intro: Satureja scabra, commonly known as rough sage, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region and parts of southern Europe. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are clustered in whorls and range in color from purple to pink, blooming in late spring to early summer. Satureja scabra is valued for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine and as a culinary herb.
